summary: This document appears to be a fragment of a policy recommendation or internal memo regarding housing for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). It argues for double-celling SHU inmates to reduce isolation and provide distraction and rescue opportunities, while noting it reduces privacy. The document's connection to the Epstein case is unclear from this fragment alone.
keyFacts: The document recommends double-celling all Special Housing Unit (SHU) inmates unless there is a compelling reason not to.
The stated benefits of double-celling are: reduces isolation, provides distraction, and provides a rescue opportunity.
A noted drawback of double-celling is that it reduces privacy.
The document is a fragment and its direct connection to Jeffrey Epstein or his case is not evident from the provided text.
